paper.title: Computational Methods for Physically-based FE Mesh Generation

paper.venue: International PROLAMAT Conference on Human Aspects in Computer Integrated Manufacturing
paper.abstract: Abstract This paper describes a new computational method for fully automated 2D/3D FE mesh generation that satisfies the basic requirements of element shape regularity, node constraint capability, and density control. We propose a physically-based approach inspired by natureu0027s shape finding process which gives topology and geometry similar to ideal FE meshes. A good 2D example is the pattern assumed by soap bubbles floating in liquid, a repeating hexagonal pattern. Connecting the bubbleu0027s center points produces a mesh of equilateral triangles. In the proposed approach, each mesh node is modeled as a bubble with a point mass and viscous damping, and bubbles attract or repel each other depending on proximity. After the final force-balancing bubble configuration is obtained by solving the governing equation of motion numerically, a complete mesh is generated by Delaunay triangulation.
